intro: Sloanea lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf sloanea, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can reach heights of up to 15 meters. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves, which are typically glossy and dark green. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by fleshy, orange-red fruits. Sloanea lanceolata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in humid, well-drained soils.
